intro: Anchusa agardhii, commonly known as the rock hyssop, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or dry habitats. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet tubular flowers. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by hairy stems and often blue or purple flowers. Anchusa agardhii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
